trans-unit.source: An abstract class that when implemented provides an identity that enables the authentication of an endpoint by clients that exchange messages with it.

The value of the identity for an endpoint can be set with constructors of <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress>, where its value can also be accessed as a read-only <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress.Identity%2A> property.
Creates an empty <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity"></xref> instance.
Creates a DNS identity with a specified DNS name.

A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain a DNS claim that represents this identity.
This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.DnsEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor <xref:System.ServiceModel.DnsEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>.
The name for the DNS identity.
A DNS associated with the specified dnsName.
dnsName is `null`.
Creates an identity with the specified claim.

A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain the identity claim used to construct this identity.

This method can create an identity of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.DnsEndpointIdentity>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.SpnEndpointIdentity>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.UpnEndpointIdentity>, or <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity>.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> used to create the new identity.
An associated with the specified identity.
identity is `null`.
Creates an RSA identity with the specified X.509 certificate.

A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain a claim that contains the RSA public key obtained from the certificate used to construct this identity.
This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the certificate for the RSA identity.
An RSA associated with the specified certificate.
certificate is `null`.
certificate is not an RSA certificate.
Creates an RSA identity with the specified public key.

A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain a claim that contains the RSA public key used to construct this identity.
This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.RsaEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>.
The public key for the RSA identity.
An RSA associated with the specified publicKey.
publicKey is `null`.
Creates a server principal name (SPN) identity with a specified name.
A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity uses the SPN when performing SSPI authentication with the endpoint.

This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.SpnEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.SpnEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>, using `spnName` as the input parameter.
If `spnName` is specified with an empty string, authentication falls back from Kerberos to NTLM if possible.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WindowsClientCredential.AllowNtlm%2A> is `false`, authentication fails.
The name for the SPN identity.
An SPN associated with the specified spnName.
spnName is `null`.
Creates a user principal name (UPN) identity with a specified name.
A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity uses the UPN when performing SSPI authentication with the endpoint.

This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.UpnEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.UpnEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>, using `upnName` as the input parameter.
If `upnName` is specified with an empty string, authentication falls back from Kerberos to NTLM if possible.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WindowsClientCredential.AllowNtlm%2A> is `false`, [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] makes a best-effort to throw an exception if NTLM is used.
Note that setting this property to `false` may not prevent NTLM credentials from being sent over the wire.
The name for the UPN identity.
A UPN associated with the specified upnName.
upnName is `null`.
Creates an X509Certificate identity with the specified certificate.

A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain the claim that contains the thumbprint of the certificate used to construct this identity.

This `static` method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.X509CertificateEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.X509CertificateEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>, using `certificate` as the input parameter.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the certificate for the identity.
An X509Certificate associated with the specified certificate.
certificate is `null`.
Creates an X509Certificate identity with the specified primary and supporting certificates.

This static method creates an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.X509CertificateEndpointIdentity> by calling its constructor, <xref:System.ServiceModel.X509CertificateEndpointIdentity.%23ctor%2A>, using `primaryCertificate` and `supportingCertificates` as input parameters.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the primary certificate for the identity.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection"></xref> that contains the supporting certificates for the identity.

A secure [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client that connects to an endpoint with this identity verifies that the claims presented by the server contain the claim that contains the thumbprint of the certificate used to construct this identity.
An X509Certificate associated with the specified primaryCertificate and supportingCertificates.
primaryCertificate or supportingCertificates is `null`.
Returns a value that determines whether a specified object is equal to the current identity object or if they have equal security properties.
`true` if the specified object other is equivalent to the current identity or contains the same security properties; otherwise, `false`.
Provides a hash code for the current instance of the identity.
The hash code for the current identity.
Gets the identity claim that corresponds to the identity.
Clients that authenticate the server should verify that the claims that represent the server contain the identity claim provided by the `EndpointIdentity`.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that represents the identity claim.
Initializes an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity"></xref> with the specified claim.
This method is called by the constructors of all the classes derived from <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity.Initialize%2A>).
Initializes an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity"></xref> with the specified claim and an interface and compares equality.
Returns the identity.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> of the form "identity(string)" where string = <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity.IdentityClaim"></xref>.
